_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A 6000 gallon (2300 lbs) above ground propane fuel tank is located on the east side of the property adjacent to a service road and parking lot.  The tank is accessible from each.  The tank facility is enclosed by a chain link fence.There is no dike or blast wall around the tank.  The structure is accessible to authorized airport persoonel and the propane supplier.   The facility is located approximately 60 ft from the Classroom Office Building (94 OEA), approximately 150 ft from the Power Plant Building (90 APB), and 1000 ft from the Airframe Building ( 89 AAB) that serves the Vincennes University teaching program.   The above ground propane tank is approximately 320 ft from the gasoline dispersal pumps and 320 ft from the above ground Fire-Guard aviation and jet fuel storage.These facilites are shielded from dirct view of the propane tank by the Classroom Office Building and the Airframe Building.  It is approximately 110 ft from a business building and 225 ft from an auto sales building, neither of which is owned by the University.   .                                                                                                                                                                       An assessment of the potential hazards of the facility are:  1.  A leak developing in the building LP Gas supply lines.  2.  Damage to underground LP lines due to excavating or digging.  3. Hose rupture during fuel transfer.  4. The propane tank developing a leak, catching on fire or exploding.                                                                                                                                                            The propane tank is set above ground on a base .  There is no dike or blast wall.                                                                                                                                                                     
Medical emergency will be handled by calling the Allison Township Fire Department
and  Knox County 911.  Because of the distance involved the Vincennes ambulance services will probably respond faster and although they must cross the state line will serve the airport facility.
